text: August Osmyn Dole (February 11, 1816 - December 7, 1876) was an American businessman and optician. Born in Shelburne, Massachusetts, he moved to Arlington, Wisconsin in 1856 and then to Poynette, Wisconsin in 1866. He owned a mill. Dole served as justice of the peace, town clerk, and on the school board. In 1876, Dole served in the Wisconsin State Assembly as a Republican. He died in Poynette, Wisconsin and was still in office at the time of his death.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1876,' Biographical Sketch of August Osmyn Dole, pg. 462'Collections of the State Historical Society of Wisconsin,' vol. 8, Madison, Wisconsin: 1879, pg. 453 ==Notes== Category:1816 births Category:1876 deaths Category:People from Shelburne, Massachusetts Category:People from Poynette, Wisconsin Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:School board members in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:19th-century American politicians Category:People from Arlington, Wisconsin
title: Augustus O. Dole
